name: NPR
text:
When D.C. resident Rahul Dubey saw protesters cornered by police, facing pepper spray and arrest for violating curfew, he did what he says anyone else would do:

He invited about 70 strangers to take shelter in his home overnight. 
https://t.co/We2XI1dpP0

name: NPR
text:
The Center for Democracy and Technology argues that President Trump's executive order attempting to strip tech companies of a key legal protection was retaliatory and violates the First Amendment.
https://t.co/DtlSjOiuUu

name: NPR
text:
This early child care center in Spokane has been operating at one-third capacity during the pandemic.

They say it's been difficult having to turn away parents asking about enrollment â€” many of whom are essential workers.
https://t.co/inNOMXJbiP

name: NPR
text:
Louisville Metro Police officials released silent security footage of what they said appears to show David McAtee firing a weapon at officers before they fatally shot him.

In one video, he is holding what appears to be cooking utensils.
https://t.co/CqLOg9wOxi

name: NPR
text: Note: We have deleted a previous tweet and updated this post to include more details of the incident.

name: NPR
text:
JUST IN: Iowa Rep. Steve King has lost his GOP primary, the AP projects. 

For years, he fired off incendiary comments about abortion and race, which lost him the support of many Republican Party leaders.
https://t.co/MAVTtvdgVU

name: NPR
text:
Minnesota has filed a discrimination complaint against the Minneapolis Police Department. The state's 
Lt. Gov. Peggy Flanagan said the action was "needed so that people can feel safe in their communities." https://t.co/TaEctHuGE7

name: NPR
text:
Many look to live music as a crucial resource â€” a place to turn for comfort, community and relief from anxiety. 

Here are a few favorite livestreaming performance series to check out ðŸ‘‡ https://t.co/PpQ3P849DY

name: NPR
text: In early March, we captured the cast and musicians of the hit Broadway musical @Hadestown pack into the Tiny Desk for a truly glorious performance of its greatest songs. https://t.co/lo1I9T0DiI

name: NPR
text: 15-year-old Jyoti Kumari's 700-mile bike ride to bring her injured father home made her a media celebrity â€” but the coverage has sparked debate on whether she is a hero or a victim of the extreme poverty that lockdowns have only worsened in India. https://t.co/zJcYqHBRg2

name: NPR
text:
Athletes are speaking up about racism â€” from activists like Kareem Abdul-Jabbar to apolitical figures like Michael Jordan. 

This solidarity is bringing awareness to peaceful protests in sports â€” including Colin Kaepernickâ€™s protest, which began in 2016. https://t.co/yO6rv6ZvND

name: NPR
text:
"Violence has no place and violence must be addressed," House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said. "But there is no reason for the U.S. military to be called out for this."
https://t.co/xxKN1khUBc

name: NPR
text:
Cyclone Nisarga has made landfall near Mumbai with wind gusts up to 75 mph.
It's the first time a cyclone has hit the area, which was hit hard by the COVID-19 pandemic, in more than a century. https://t.co/nfAkNc4lp4

name: NPR
text:
Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau was asked at a press conference to respond to President Trump's actions amid protests for George Floyd in the U.S.

The question left him speechless for 21 seconds. https://t.co/VMTAEKPr6Z

name: NPR
text: Protesters again filled the streets nationwide â€“ even in smaller towns and despite curfews â€“ over the killing of George Floyd and the disproportionately high number of black Americans who face injustice, violence and death. https://t.co/bAgRDUVCJ4

name: NPR
text:
Commenting on protests sparked by police brutality and the death of George Floyd, Pope Francis says that Catholics cannot tolerate racism and also "claim to defend the sacredness of every human life."
https://t.co/2f9QPdsjMQ

name: NPR
text:
Millions of Americans are having to skip payments on mortgages, auto loans and other bills right now.

But help from hardship programs still isn't reaching may people who need it.
https://t.co/I8rB7mWU96

name: NPR
text: WATCH LIVE: Former Deputy Attorney General Rod Rosenstein is testifying before the Senate Judiciary Committee about the origins of the Russia investigation and the FBIâ€™s use of surveillance.  https://t.co/eljdVH5LR3

name: NPR
text: Tear gas hurts people's lungs, making them more susceptible to coronavirus infection -- and making it more likely to spread in tight protest crowds. "If somebody has COVID-19 and they get tear gassed, they're going to be coughing more." @KQEDnews https://t.co/EYPrpjcq0h

name: NPR
text:
Ella Jones made history on Tuesday by becoming the first black mayor of Ferguson, Mo.

When asked what her historic victory means to her, she responded: "That means I got work to do."
https://t.co/IwUTJXzts3

name: NPR
text:
RT @npr_ed: The time has come... introducing the winners of the 2020 NPR Student Podcast Challenge! ðŸŽŠðŸŽ‰

https://t.co/qi98B3xmVQ

name: NPR
text:
Rod Rosenstein, who appointed Robert Mueller, is testifying today before the Senate Judiciary Committee, as President Trump's allies seek to tie Joe Biden to what they call "abuses" in the Russia investigation.
https://t.co/nQPsjT1Rz0

name: NPR
text:
ICYMI: Iowa Rep. Steve King has lost his bid for reelection.

King has a long history of making racist and incendiary comments, including wondering out loud to The New York Times last year why "white supremacist" is an offensive term.
https://t.co/pSEMJUQY31

name: NPR
text:
Two weeks after Israel fully reopened schools, officials are again closing dozens of them after a COVID-19 outbreak. A new policy orders any school where a case emerges to close.
https://t.co/pPjAKhbgI1

name: NPR
text:
Defense Secretary Mark Esper disagreed with Trump's threat to use the military to quell widespread unrest over the death of George Floyd, saying that should only be done "in the most urgent and dire of situations."

"We are not in one of those situations." https://t.co/nGdvW0s0YM

name: NPR
text: NEW: Derek Chauvin is now facing a charge of second-degree murder, and 3 other former Minneapolis police officers who were involved in George Floyd's death are facing charges of aiding and abetting. https://t.co/6oRhqX9Olg
